text: Tips to make friends: 1. Look out for people who have similar interests and hobbies. Most friendships start because people have things in common. 2. Go out and meet them. Sometimes we get so busy with our schedules that we don't get time to meet and talk with people. So you can meet people at some groups get-together party, etc. 3. You can always start a conversation with an introduction, greetings, or by asking, "how are you? " never be shy about talking; be confident and have a smiling face. 4. It is also imperative to be a good listener. 5. Compliment them. Don't be a miser about it. You can always compliment your friend about his or her looks, style, intelligence, clothes, skills, humour, etc. 6. Not everyone can be the same as you. Everyone is different, so accept others as they are. Dont try to change them. 7. Always share your food, meals, or belongings with your friends. Sharing is caring. 8. A person who helps others has a lot of friends who help him back later. 9. Be a loyal and trustworthy person

question: What is the role of a family in nurturing and support?
context: The role of family is multi-faceted and essential in various aspects of life. Here are some key roles that families play: (1) nurturing and support: families provide emotional support, care, and nurturing to their members. They create a sense of belonging and offer a safe and loving environment where individuals can grow, develop, and thrive. (2) basic needs provision: families fulfil basic needs such as food, shelter, clothing, and healthcare. text: Some possible causes of itching in the groin area include fungal infections: conditions such as jock itch (tinea cruris) caused by a fungal infection can lead to itching in the groin region. Contact dermatitis: exposure to irritants or allergens in soaps, detergents, fabrics, or personal care products can cause itching and skin irritation in the groin area. Moisture and friction: excessive moisture, sweat, and friction in the groin area, particularly in warm or humid environments, can lead to itching and skin irritation. Skin conditions: certain skin conditions like eczema or psoriasis can manifest with itching in the groin area. Hygiene practices: poor hygiene, infrequent bathing, or using harsh soaps can contribute to itching and discomfort in the groin region.

text: To measure your bra cup size, you will need a soft measuring tape and follow these steps: take the under bust measurement: stand straight and wrap the measuring tape snugly around your ribcage, just beneath your breasts. Ensure the tape is parallel to the ground and take note of the measurement in inches or centimetres. This will give you your band size. Measure the bust: keep the measuring tape around your back and bring it across the fullest part of your bust. Make sure the tape is not too tight or too loose and record the measurement. Calculate the difference: subtract your under bust measurement from your bust measurement. The difference between the two measurements will determine your cup size. Use a bra size chart or calculator to find your corresponding cup size based on the difference.

text: The symptoms of cervical cancer can vary, and in the early stages, there may be no noticeable signs. However, as the cancer progresses, the following symptoms may occur: abnormal vaginal bleeding: this includes bleeding between periods, after sexual intercourse, or after menopause. It may also involve unusually heavy or prolonged menstrual bleeding. Unusual vaginal discharge: cervical cancer can cause a watery, bloody, or foul-smelling discharge that may be persistent. Pelvic pain: persistent pain in the pelvic area, including pain during sexual intercourse or pelvic examinations, can be a symptom of cervical cancer. Painful urination: some women with cervical cancer may experience pain or discomfort during urination. Back or leg pain: as the cancer progresses, it may spread to nearby tissues and organs, leading to back or leg pain.

However, as the cancer progresses, the following symptoms may occur: abnormal vaginal bleeding: this includes bleeding between periods, after sexual intercourse, or after menopause. It may also involve unusually heavy or prolonged menstrual bleeding. Unusual vaginal discharge: cervical cancer can cause a watery, bloody, or foul-smelling discharge that may be persistent. Pelvic pain: persistent pain in the pelvic area, including pain during sexual intercourse or pelvic examinations, can be a symptom of cervical cancer. Painful urination: some women with cervical cancer may experience pain or discomfort during urination. Back or leg pain: as the cancer progresses, it may spread to nearby tissues and organs, leading to back or leg pain. It's important to note that these symptoms can also be caused by conditions other than cervical cancer. text: Ways to deal with an itchy scrotum due to the fungal infection (dermatophytes) in the groin called tinea cruris: 1. Wear loose underwear like boxers, etc. 2. Keep the groyne dry after the bath and wear dry underwear. 3. Use anti-fungal creams like clotrimazole, etc. 4. Feel free to consult a doctor as soon as possible.

Pre-menstrual syndrome (pms) is a set of physical and psychological symptoms that start anywhere from a few days to two weeks before a woman gets her monthly period (menstruation). The causes of pms are not completely clear. But it is thought that hormonal fluctuations during a womans monthly cycle play a role. Many women experience breast tenderness and abdominal pain, for instance. Other symptoms include headaches, back pain and joint or muscle ache. Water retention, sleep

text: Many women experience breast tenderness and abdominal pain, for instance. Other symptoms include headaches, back pain and joint or muscle ache. Water retention, sleep problems or digestion problems, skin blemishes and food cravings may occur too
question: What are some common symptoms of PMS mentioned in the passage?
context: syndrome (pms) is a set of physical and psychological symptoms that start anywhere from a few days to two weeks before a woman gets her monthly period (menstruation). The causes of pms are not completely clear. But it is thought that hormonal fluctuations during a womans monthly cycle play a role. Many women experience breast tenderness and abdominal pain, for instance. Other symptoms include headaches, back pain and joint or muscle ache. Water retention, sleep problems or digestion problems, skin blemishes and food cravings may occur too. Women who have pms often feel exhausted, insecure, down, listless, irritable, or angry in the days leading up to their period. Some have problems concentrating and experience mood swings. They might feel like they are losing control over their body and emotions. Severe pms can really affect everyd

To deal with pms: get enough exercise and sports use relaxation techniques and meditating do not smoke drink less alcohol and caffeine eat less salt medications can be also used for severe pms symptoms, feel free to consult a doctor.

text: It can be divided into coitus and non-coital sex. Coitus sex is the penile insertion into the females vagina. Non-coital sex is hugging, kissing (cheek, body, or on the mouth), touching, stimulating, and masturbation
question: What are the two main categories of sexual acts mentioned in the passage, and how are they defined?
context: Sexual intercourse, or a sexual act (most people call it "sex), is usually performed between two mature adults with consent who are legally married or in a romantic relationship. It can be divided into coitus and non-coital sex. Coitus sex is the penile insertion into the females vagina. Non-coital sex is hugging, kissing (cheek, body, or on the mouth), touching, stimulating, and masturbation. Sexual intercourse is a natural biological function like respiration, eating and defecation. Healthy individuals have sex for reproduction or pleasure or for body need. You dont have to do anything if you dont want to have sex. Sex is something that is enjoyed only if it is done out of free will.

text: Sexual consent is an agreement to participate in sexual activity. It could be verbal (communicated) or in written form. Consent is never in the form of physical gestures, body signs, objects, indirect signals, actions, dress, etc. Consent is never implied based on past behaviour, activity, or dress. Valid consent is consent without any pressure or threat, without any influence of drugs or alcohol. Consent is always reversible at any point in time, and it must be very specific for every step or activity
question: How is sexual consent defined, and what are the key elements of valid consent mentioned in the passage?
context: nt have to do anything if you dont want to have sex. Sex is something that is enjoyed only if it is done out of free will. Right now, it might seem quite strange to you, but later you might change your mind. Thats ok. Sex is a way of expressing ourselves and our feelings. It is not dirty or wicked. Sexual consent is an agreement to participate in sexual activity. It could be verbal (communicated) or in written form. Consent is never in the form of physical gestures, body signs, objects, indirect signals, actions, dress, etc. Consent is never implied based on past behaviour, activity, or dress. Valid consent is consent without any pressure or threat, without any influence of drugs or alcohol. Consent is always reversible at any point in time, and it must be very specific for every step or activity. Consent is required before every sexual act in life, even if you are a married couple or your partner is a sex worker. A sexual act without consent is always wrong and considered rape, which is a punishable crime. Everyone has the right to be in control of what they will and will not do with their

Abortion is generally illegal in malaysia, except in specific circumstances. The relevant law governing abortion in malaysia is the penal code, under sections 312 to 316. According to these sections, abortion is a criminal offence unless it is necessary to save the life of the pregnant woman or if it is performed with the intention of preserving the woman's physical or mental health. In cases where an abortion is deemed necessary, it must be performed by a registered medical practitioner in a government-approved facility. Vasectomy is a surgical procedure that involves cutting or blocking the vas deferens, the tubes that carry sperm from the testicles to the urethra. It is a form of permanent contraception for men, as it prevents sperm from reaching the semen ejaculated during sexual intercourse. After a vasectomy, men typically continue to produce sperm, but the sperm are absorbed by the body instead of being ejaculated. text: Sexually transmitted infections (stis or stds) are infections caused by bacteria, viruses, and parasites transmitted through sexual contact, including vaginal, anal, and oral sex. Some stis may also be spread by skin-to-skin sexual contact or through non-sexual means, such as from mother to child during pregnancy and childbirth
question: How are sexually transmitted infections (STIs or STDs) transmitted?
context: Sexually transmitted infections (stis or stds) are infections caused by bacteria, viruses, and parasites transmitted through sexual contact, including vaginal, anal, and oral sex. Some stis may also be spread by skin-to-skin sexual contact or through non-sexual means, such as from mother to child during pregnancy and childbirth. There are more than 30 known bacteria, viruses, and parasites that cause stis. Eight of these pathogens are linked to the greatest incidence of sexually transmitted disease. text: Stress management skills for young people and adults: 1. Talk about problems with other trusted people like friends, parents, teachers, etc. 2. Take deep breaths, accompanied by thinking or saying aloud, "i can handle this". 3. Perform progressive muscle relaxation, which involves repeatedly tensing and relaxing large muscles of the body. You can count from 10 to 1 (reverse counting). 4. Set small goals and break tasks into smaller, manageable chunks. 5. Exercise and eat regular meals. Involve in outdoor sports and be physically active. 6. Get proper sleep, at least 6-7 hours per day. 7. Break the habit of relying on caffeine or energy drinks to get through the day. 8. Focus on what you can control (your reactions, your actions) and let go of what you cannot (other peoples opinions and expectations). 9. Work through worst-case scenarios until they seem amusing or absurd 10. Lower unrealistic expectations. 11. Schedule breaks and enjoyable activities. 12. Accept yourself as you are

Protection of children from sexual offences (pocso) act was introduced in 2012, which it was enacted with the aim of protecting children below the age of 18. It provides a robust legal framework for the protection of children from offences of sexual assault, sexual harassment, and pornography, it also criminalises acts of immodesty against children too. It criminalises even watching or collection of pornographic content involving children. The framing of the act seeks to put children first by making it easy to use by including mechanisms for child-friendly reporting, recording of evidence, investigation, and speedy trial of offences through designated special courts. If he doesnt know the meaning but can understand some, then explain it to him the meaning. He starts thinking twice before using such words. 4. Find out his source of learning and cut that source out. 5. Don't laugh and discourage your friends and family from laughing when he says a bad word. He will interpret laughter as encouragement.
